conclusion: A drives in from the group of blocks on the right.
There is a blue block closest to the right edge of the image.
A will collide with the blue block closest to the right edge of the image.
The collision with the blue block will cause A to deflect slightly to the left.
A will continue to move forward after deflecting slightly to the left.
There is a green block closest to the bottom edge of the image.
A will collide with the green block closest to the bottom edge of the image.
The collision with the green block will cause A to deflect slightly to the right.
A will continue to move forward after deflecting slightly to the right.
There is an orange block closest to the bottom right corner of the image.
A will eventually stop after colliding with the orange block closest to the bottom right corner of the image.
The power of A's movement and the deflection effects from the collisions will cause it to come to a stop in this position.
